How can I incorporate the following excel table data into my Python code to create a chart using Matplotlib? 
| Month     | Sales     |
|-----------|-----------|
| January   | 20000     |
| February  | 22000     |
| March     | 25000     |
| April     | 28000     |
| May       | 31000     |
| June      | 33000     |
| July      | 35000     |
| August    | 38000     |
| September | 41000     |
| October   | 43000     |
| November  | 45000     |
| December  | 47000     |
Please provide the Python code with the incorporated Excel data in [excel table] format.

To incorporate the Excel table data into your Python code and create a chart using Matplotlib, you can manually input the data into your code or read it from an Excel file. Here's an example of how you can manually input the data and create a bar chart using Matplotlib:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Data from the Excel table
months = [
    "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June",
    "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December"
]
sales = [
    20000, 22000, 25000, 28000, 31000, 33000,
    35000, 38000, 41000, 43000, 45000, 47000
]

# Create a bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.bar(months, sales, color='skyblue')
plt.title('Monthly Sales Data')
plt.xlabel('Month')
plt.ylabel('Sales')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```

If your data is stored in an Excel file, you can use the `pandas` library to read the data from the Excel file and then plot it. Here's how you can do it:

```python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the data from an Excel file
# Make sure to replace 'your_file.xlsx' with the path to your file
df = pd.read_excel('your_file.xlsx')

# Extracting data from the DataFrame
months = df['Month'].tolist()
sales = df['Sales'].tolist()

# Create a bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.bar(months, sales, color='skyblue')
plt.title('Monthly Sales Data')
plt.xlabel('Month')
plt.ylabel('Sales')
plt.xticks(rotation=45)
plt.tight_layout()

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```

Make sure you have the necessary libraries installed. You can install them using:

```bash
pip install pandas matplotlib openpyxl
```

This code will read the Excel file, extract the `Month` and `Sales` columns, and create a bar chart using Matplotlib. Adjust the file path as needed for your specific Excel file location.
